declarations.comments: Runs a `Match` parser.
declarations.title: match

declarations.comments: Runs a `Match` parser given a custom String decoder.
declarations.title: matchWith

declarations.comments: Runs a `Match` parser given a custom String decoder.
declarations.title: matchWith

declarations.comments: Runs a `Match` parser.
declarations.title: match

declarations.comments: Gets the global location hash.
declarations.title: getHash

declarations.comments: Sets the global location hash.
declarations.title: setHash

declarations.comments: Modifies the global location hash.
declarations.title: modifyHash

declarations.comments:
Folds effectfully over hash changes given a callback and an initial hash.
The provided String is the hash portion of the `Location` with the '#'
prefix stripped. Returns an effect which will remove the listener.
declarations.title: foldHashes

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every hash change providing the previous hash and the
latest hash. The provided String is the hash portion of the `Location` with
the '#' prefix stripped. Returns an effect which will remove the listener.
declarations.title: hashes

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every hash change using a given `Match` parser to
extract a route from the hash. If a hash fails to parse, it is ignored.
To avoid dropping hashes, provide a fallback alternative in your parser.
Returns an effect which will remove the listener.
declarations.title: matches

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every hash change using a given custom parser to
extract a route from the hash. If a hash fails to parse, it is ignored.
To avoid dropping hashes, provide a fallback alternative in your parser.
Returns an effect which will remove the listener.
declarations.title: matchesWith

declarations.comments: Matches a leading slash.
declarations.title: root

declarations.comments:
`lit x` will match exactly the path component `x`.
For example, `lit "x"` matches `/x`.
declarations.title: lit

declarations.comments: `num` matches any numerical path component.
declarations.title: num

declarations.comments: `int` matches any integer path component.
declarations.title: int

declarations.comments: `bool` matches any boolean path component.
declarations.title: bool

declarations.comments:
`str` matches any path string component.
For example, `str` matches `/foo` as `"foo"`.
declarations.title: str

declarations.comments:
`param p` matches a parameter assignment `q=v` within a query block.
For example, `param "q"` matches `/?q=a&r=b` as `"a"`.
declarations.title: param

declarations.comments:
`params` matches an entire query block. For exmaple, `params`
matches `/?q=a&r=b` as the map `{q : "a", r : "b"}`. Note that
`lit "foo" *> params` does *not* match `/foo`, since a query component
is *required*.
declarations.title: params

declarations.comments: `end` matches the end of a route.
declarations.title: end

declarations.comments: Matches a non-empty string.
declarations.title: nonempty

declarations.comments:
Matches list of matchers. Useful when argument can easy fail (not `str`)
returns `Match Nil` if no matches
declarations.title: list

declarations.comments:
if we match something that can fail then we have to
match `Either a b`. This function converts matching on such
sum to matching on right subpart. Matching on left branch fails.
i.e.
```purescript
data Sort = Asc | Desc
sortOfString :: String -> Either String Sort
sortOfString "asc" = Right Asc
sortOfString "desc" = Right Desc
sortOfString _ = Left "incorrect sort"

newtype Routing = Routing Sort
routes :: Match Routing
routes = (pure Routing) <*> (eitherMatch (sortOfString <$> var))

```
declarations.title: eitherMatch

declarations.comments:
useful for matching optional params at the end of a path
```
optParams = maybe M.empty id <$> optionalMatch params <* end
runMatch (lit "path" *> optParams) (parse id "path/?a=1")
-- (Right (fromFoldable [(Tuple "a" "1")]))
```
declarations.title: optionalMatch

declarations.comments:
Parse hash string to `Route` with `decoder` function
applied to every hash part (usually `decodeURIComponent`)
declarations.title: parse

declarations.comments:
A `PushStateInterface` is a localized instance for making location changes
and consuming the events. Since the DOM API does not provide a general
event type for push state (only pop), you must use the coupled effects
along with `listen` to receive events on all location changes.

* `pushState` – pushes a new location state and path onto the history stack.
* `replaceState` – replaces the location state and path in the history stack.
* `locationState` – Dereferences the current history state
* `listen` – Subscribes to location changes (both push and pop). Returns
  an effect which removes the listener.
declarations.title: PushStateInterface

declarations.comments:
Creates a new `PushStateInterface`. Generally you should only create one
instance for your application. Since the DOM does not provide general
events for location changes, listeners will only be notified on push when
using the paired functions.
declarations.title: makeInterface

declarations.comments:
Folds effectfully over location changes given callbacks for handling
changes and the initial location. Returns an effect which removes the
listener.
declarations.title: foldLocations

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every location change providing the previous location
and the latest location. Returns an effect which removes the listener.
declarations.title: locations

declarations.comments:
Folds effectfully over path changes given callbacks for handling changes
and the initial path. Returns an effect which removes the listener.
declarations.title: foldPaths

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every path change providing the previous path and
the latest path. Returns an effect which removes the listener.
declarations.title: paths

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every path change using a given `Match` parser to
extract a route from the path. If a path fails to parse, it is ignored.
To avoid dropping paths, provide a fallback alternative in your parser.
Returns an effect which removes the listener.
declarations.title: matches

declarations.comments:
Runs the callback on every path change using a given custom parser to
extract a route from the path. If a path fails to parse, it is ignored.
To avoid dropping paths, provide a fallback alternative in your parser.
Returns an effect which removes the listener.
declarations.title: matchesWith
